alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:09PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cochise County through 500 PM MST... At 409 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles west of Cloverdale, or 21 miles east of Douglas, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly remote areas of southeastern Cochise County. This includes Route 80 between mile markers 382 and 394. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
